intro: Fadogia stigmatoloba, commonly known as African tamarind, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces a pod-like fruit that contains several seeds. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Fadogia stigmatoloba is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
